result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Logan A Borneman

records.addlTxt:
11:15 AM Defendant Logan A Borneman in court.  Attorney David Gardner Casey in court for Logan A Borneman.  Prosecuting attorney Kristopher R Ellis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called appearances given.  State is amending the charge to a misdemeanor. (no preliminary hearing needed)  Deft enters a plea of guilty to amended charge (Posses of THC 961.41(3g)(e)) Count 2 is DRI and 22FO106 and 22TR803 are DRI.  Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty. 

State addresses the Court as to the reasoning for the sentence of deferred prosecution.

Conviction is stayed due to 961.47 deferred judgment of conviction and orders the deft to 12 months probation.  Upon competition of probation the charge will be dismissed. 
NOTE: this statue can only be used once per deft.   Court is not opposed to the probation being served in Marathon County.
Absolute sobriety. Shall not consume or possess alcoholic beverages or controlled substances.  May take prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages. May not go on tavern/bar premises except for employment purposes. 
AODA assessment and treatment
Preliminary hearing on August 26, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Counsel
Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Counsel

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:32 PM - case called.  Defendant Logan A Borneman appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Nicholas Smith appeared by video, specially.  Attorney Kristopher R Ellis in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Smith - in receipt of complaint - waive reading.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court sets bond.  Attorney Smith waives time limits for scheduling the preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.
Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
